The evidence paths indicating that these drugs treat malaria do not extend to effects on the retina, thus confirming the lack of direct relevance to retinal pigmentation.

In conclusion, among the options provided, Chloroquine is the only drug that has a well-established link to causing retinal pigmentation due to its accumulation in the retina and subsequent retinal toxicity.
